page.title: 14ENTERTAINMENT IN LECHLADE
page.content: { }The Victoria Memorial Hall is a big meeting place. It was given to the town by Mrs. James Jones in 1919. A kitchen, bar and toilets have been added to the main hall. It is used all year for meetings, dances, discos and rummage sales and is the stage for pantomimes and plays. It is administered by a committee. On Sundays it is used as a Baptist Church by some members of the American Armed Forces living locally. The rest of the week is timetabled:- Monday - Senior Citizens Social Club. Tuesday - Day Centre Monthly W.I. Meeting. Wednesday - Child Welfare Clinic. Health and Beauty Class. Thursday - W.I. Market Silver Threads Meeting.
